pr_title: Lock copybook download queue in case of wrong MF credentials

timeline.body: With the new value defined here, I think is time to find a more appropriate value for that enum. In past was named ```TextDocumentSyncType``` because was the reference in the LSP protocol specification for ```DID_OPEN``` and ```DID_CHANGE```
timeline.bodyText: With the new value defined here, I think is time to find a more appropriate value for that enum. In past was named TextDocumentSyncType because was the reference in the LSP protocol specification for DID_OPEN and DID_CHANGE
timeline.bodyHTML: With the new value defined here, I think is time to find a more appropriate value for that enum. In past was named TextDocumentSyncType because was the reference in the LSP protocol specification for DID_OPEN and DID_CHANGE
timeline.author: andzac

replies.bodyText: It may be replaced with according methods in CopybookProcessingMode
replies.author: temanbrcom

timeline.author: andzac

timeline.body: If I remember correctly, ID in `@Assisted` required only if there are some similar types injected. Now, all the parameters have different types, so you may use `@Assisted` without ID
timeline.bodyText: If I remember correctly, ID in @Assisted required only if there are some similar types injected. Now, all the parameters have different types, so you may use @Assisted without ID
timeline.bodyHTML: If I remember correctly, ID in @Assisted required only if there are some similar types injected. Now, all the parameters have different types, so you may use @Assisted without ID

replies.bodyText: Cool, I can even delete the entire @Assested.
